function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Delay in u.s. federal agencies’ interest in wbe for covid-19 tracking","category":"Lack of global governance and coordination","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Strategies involving the rejection or exclusion of people from cities or the imposition of controls upon the movements of entire populations as historical ways of exerting power in response to public health threats.","category":"Lack of global governance and coordination","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Association between disease outbreaks and urban governance","category":"Global coordination challenges","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Focussing on three very different cities -jerusalem, phnom penh and torontothey reveal how histories of colonial occupation and planning, of postcolonial economic modernization and of entrepreneurial planning geared to promoting competitive global cities have produced conditions germane to the uneven spread and impacts of covid-19.","category":"Globalization challenges","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Perception of science and research funding","category":"Lack of transparency and clarity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sociopolitical barriers to data sharing within and between institutions","category":"Lack of global governance and coordination","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Severe restrictions to mobility exacerbating social inequalities","category":"Globalization challenges","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of transparent and effective governance","category":"Lack of transparency and clarity","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incomplete or inaccurate communication from health authorities","category":"Lack of transparency and clarity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent use of research evidence in informing decisions","category":"Weak local decision-making mechanisms","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Top-down approach to decision-making with political and economic considerations taking precedence over research and health directives","category":"Weak local decision-making mechanisms","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relevant evidence may exist but decision-makers may be unaware or unable to interpret or apply it to their own context.","category":"Ineffectiveness of interventions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decision-makers are influenced by numerous forces, including institutional constraints, political context, interest group pressures, and personal convictions.","category":"Weak local decision-making mechanisms","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of responsiveness to changing priorities and needs","category":"Weak local decision-making mechanisms","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to identify context-specific knowledge gaps and priorities","category":"Ineffectiveness of interventions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of clarity on roles and responsibilities for pandemic response","category":"Lack of transparency and clarity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure of top-down approach in achieving desired impact for covid-19","category":"Weak local decision-making mechanisms","confidence":"High"},{"name":"History of epidemics driving housing reforms and urban regeneration","category":"Globalization challenges","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Migration away from crowded cities leads to changes in the form and type of housing, potentially impacting disease spread in new areas.","category":"Globalization challenges","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Barriers restricting movement of labor and population due to clarity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher occurrence and fatalities in certain countries","category":"Globalization challenges","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of representation of studies
